Package com.ojcoleman.europa.configurable

Contains classes for building a - typically hierarchically structured - collection of parametrised components that can be configured via a JSON configuration file.

See: Description

  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    IDFactory
    Interface for factory that creates a unique ID on every request.
    Observer
    Simple implementation of the Observer part of the Observer pattern.
  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    ComponentBase
    A base class for classes that represent a user-configurable component of the software.
    ComponentStateLog
    Stores data about the state of a ComponentBase.
    ConfigurableBase
    A base class for classes that are configurable via a JSON configuration file.
    Configuration
    Describes the configuration for a ConfigurableBase.
    DefaultIDFactory
    Default class to generate unique UDs.
    Observable
    Simple implementation of the Subject part of the Observer pattern.
    PrototypeBase
    In Europa the class to use for many types of object is determined at run-time, for example the class to use for an individual or a genotype.
  • Enum Summary 
    Enum Description
    Observable.Event
    Basic event types.
  • Exception Summary 
    Exception Description
    ComponentConstructorException
    Indicates that an exception occurred in the constructor of a ComponentBase when trying to instantiate it as a sub-component of another component.
    ComponentInitialisationLoopException
    Indicates that two or more components are requesting access to each other during their initialisation.
    ComponentMissingConstructorException
    Indicates that a sub-class of ComponentBase does not implement a constructor accepting a ComponentBase and JsonObject as parameter.
    ConfigurableException
    Base class for all exceptions generated by classes in this package.
    ConfigurableMissingConfigurationConstructorException
    Indicates that a sub-class of ConfigurableBase does not implement a constructor accepting a single parameter of type Configuration.
    InvalidConfigurableAnnotationException
    Indicates that the element values for an Parameter annotation are invalid.
    InvalidConfigurableFieldException
    Indicates an invalid configuration for a field annotated with Parameter, Configurable, Prototype or Component.
    InvalidConfigurationException
    Exception indicating an invalid set of configuration values has been provided.
    InvalidParameterFieldException
    Indicates an error with a field annotated Parameter.
    InvalidParameterValueException
    Indicates that the value provided for a Parameter field in a ComponentBase is invalid (failed validation such as acceptable range or regex matching).
    NewInstanceConstructorException
    Indicates that an exception occurred in the constructor of an object being instantiated by ConfigurableBase.newGenericInstance(Class).
    PrototypeMissingCopyConstructorException
    Indicates that a sub-class of Prototype does not implement a copy constructor accepting a single parameter of the sub-class type.
    RequiredComponentDefinitionMissingException
    Indicates that a Component field in a ComponentBase which has no default implementation specified and is not optional has not had a definition specifying an implementation provided for it.
    RequiredParameterValueMissingException
    Indicates that a Parameter field in a ComponentBase which has no default value and is not optional has not had a value provided for it.
  • Annotation Types Summary 
    Annotation Type Description
    Component
    For fields in sub-classes of ComponentBase, this annotation indicates that the field is for a user configurable ComponentBase object or array of objects, e.g.
    Configurable
    For fields in sub-classes of ConfigurableBase, this annotation indicates that the field is for a user configurable object, e.g.
    Parameter
    For fields in sub-classes of ConfigurableBase, this annotation indicates that the field is user configurable, e.g.
    Prototype
    For fields in sub-classes of ConfigurableBase, this annotation indicates that the field is for a user configurable PrototypeBase object, e.g.

Package com.ojcoleman.europa.configurable Description

Contains classes for building a - typically hierarchically structured - collection of parametrised components that can be configured via a JSON configuration file. See ComponentBase for more information.
